comment: One of the best ECE professers, very knowledgeable and helpful. I took both CPE 3000 and 3020 with him, so I had to balance the labs of both classes(can be challenging). I HIGHLY recommend going to office hours if you are struggling in anyway. It's practically asking for an A in 3020. The class can be quite rigorous if unprepared or lost.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: A very knowledgeable professor with decades of industry experience. Weekly (ish) in-person quizzes but otherwise no mandatory attendance. Interesting lectures, great personality, and very understanding with grading. Never any surprise assignments. No formal exams besides the final

Tippens is an amazing professor. He is very knowledgeable about FPGAs and VHDL, and he is willing to work with you if you have problems or don't understand something. He is a little picky about the block diagrams, however when you have a good diagram it makes the class easier.

VHDL is a hard class but Dr. Tippens and his humor will help get you through it. Grade consists of 5 labs, 2 practicums, 6 quizzes, and a final. The hardest part of the class was the labs so make sure you have a strong lab group. Make sure to go to class as the quizzes are based around examples done during lecture. Don't be afraid to ask questions.

One of the best profs and courses in ECE. The most rigorous course I've taken, but I've learned so much compared to other classes. Its lab-heavy with alternating lab assignments and practicums, and also short in-class quizzes that are easy if you pay attention to lecture examples. You will become a better engineer after this class!

Professor Tippens changes his approach on teaching depending on the class. He might do something different for the next semester's course. He challenges you and most definitely helps you on succeeding your milestones. He is a exceptional professor that really care for the students. See him if you need help, same goes for other courses he teaches.

I wish we had more time to pick/ come up with project ideas. And a few milestone assignments felt unnecessary. Milestone instructions were also vague.  He is really good at presenting. I also liked he would use our project as examples for lecture topics.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment:
Scott has been the best professor I've had this semester. He teaches really well, his lectures are really good to learn fast, he inspires students and relates content with real actual industry applications.
He cares about students doing good with lab sessions and helps them with any question they might have. Please take him!! You wont regret!

Dr. Tippens is a great professor, I have had him for 3 different classes and he never fails make the material stick inside my head. I would be lying if I said he was an easy professor, but it is mainly him challenging you to better yourself. For VHDL, there are 5 labs, 1 project, 3 tests(54%), and a final. He also has attendance quizzes regularly.

Dr. Tippens is a great professor, and is hilarious. I would be lying if I said his class was easy but it is supposed to be challenging. I have had him for 3 different classes now and every single one of them I have learned the most out of a course than any other class I have taken at KSU. There are 5 labs, 1 project, 3 tests, and attendance quizzes

He graded very hard, and this class can vary because it is a project based class and it depends what your project is on, and the difficulty of building it. There are milestones, a poster, a presentation, and a report. However, he will help if needed, but he will not spoonfed you.

There are 5 labs, a project that counts as a bunch of labs with extra credit if achieved, 3 tests (1 test can be dropped), and a final. You will need to pay attention and study for his class. You will also need to ask for help because the labs are not easy. He will help you, but not spoon feed you. His class made me feel like a real engineer

This class was somewhat harder than necessary. For example, the physical model, he wanted us to shape the parts we will be using when we make our real model. We worked hard and we got an A. Also he will criticize every little thing that is wrong with it and asks questions so you know how everything works with each other.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: I can definitely see why Professor Tippens is the ideal professor for Digital III. This is a course to be taken seriously and was definitely the most difficult course I have taken yet. It demands a plethora of time and effort throughout the entire semester. One thing to note is that he is very picky about two things: schematics and wire connectors.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: The tests during the semester were a little tough but manageable. Also had a group project at the end. Would recommend.

Tippens is a very tough Prof. He will make you work but at the end of the semester you'll come out of his class feeling like a real engineer. If you're serious about digital, embedded systems, and hardware, he's the Prof you want to take.

Very hard class, but I don't think any other professor could teach it. Tippens loves the subject matter, and it shows in his lectures. The hardest part of this class is working together in your group, try your best to work well with your teammates. If you hate your teammates you will hate this class, and vise versa.

Tippens is great. He is very kind and gets a bad rep because the class itself is hard. He is always willing to help if he is in his office or during lab time. He will suggest ideas or point you in the right direction, but he is there to help you learn, not spoon feed you. I learned so much in this class. He grades fairly and is very understanding

Good guy, can be helpful sometimes. But needs to move away from using the old 8051 micro controllers. He expects you to know the 8051, but fails to realize not everyone is native to the 8051. I normally use the Arduino becomes its easier to write code for than the 8051 and speeds up development.

He is not helpful at all. he thinks you should know coding and everything from D2. One of the worst professors I ever had, I would advise to stay away but sadly he is the only professor that teaches D3. SO good luck.

If you treat him and the subject with respect you'll find one of the best professors giving you the best academic experiences you'll ever have. Use him for inspiration not as an knowledge base for your problems. also.. take distributed MCs, VHDL, and systems engineering too for three times the fun.
Great professor. Challenging but not unreasonably so. Only negative is that he leaves labs unattended. If you have questions your must go find him in his office.
Good professor. Helpful with good sense of humor. Collects one problem from each homework. Tests are challenging but not unreasonably so.
He is a great teacher. Detail on the lecture, even better than read the book by yourself. Sometimes he did make some hard tests, but if you pay attention on his lecture then you will get a 100.

One of the best ECET professors, he let you do what ever you want for porjects. He will give a problem and let you determine how it should be solved! VERY helpful, but is not going to hold your hand! BEST Prof ever!
Great teacher.  He turns you loose and lets you do what you want with your project without intereference.  However, he does expect a lot out of the finished product!
Great teacher, pretty hard though
